meanings.definition: To deliver a speech or make a public declaration on a soapbox.
meanings.sent1: He soapboxed about the importance of recycling in the park.
meanings.sent2: She soapboxed passionately about animal rights at the rally.
meanings.sent3: At the picnic, he soapboxed about the best way to grill hotdogs.
meanings.sent4: She soapboxed her love for gardening to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent5: The teacher soapboxed the rules of the classroom to the new students.

meanings.definition: To express one's opinions or beliefs in a forceful or self-righteous manner.
meanings.sent1: The politician soapboxed his views on education during the debate.
meanings.sent2: She soapboxed about the dangers of fast food consumption.
meanings.sent3: He soapboxed about the benefits of waking up early every day.
meanings.sent4: She soapboxed her dislike for horror movies to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The coach soapboxed the importance of teamwork to the players.
